data.name: Custom Regex Language
data.description:
Write a function 'my-regex' that will perform string matching for my newly invented regular expression language. The rules for the language are as follows. 1. Alpha character = Alpha character. Ex: "codewars" = "codewars" 2. The '+' character matches any one character. Ex: "codewars" = "c+d+w+r+" 3. The '\*' character matches 0 to an infinite number of any characters. Ex: "codewars" = "\*", or "codewars" = "+ode\*s", or "codewars" = "\*\*codewars\*".
The function 'my-regex' should take an input string and a regex string, and it should return true or false if they match. You can assume that the input string will always be lowercase alpha characters only. No spaces, numbers, or special characters (like '+' or '\*'). NOTE: The purpose of this question is to implement the regex processing yourself, not to use re-matches or re-pattern. See if you can solve it without using built in regex functions.
